Posts.Content: After seeing several doctors, I have decided to do the same thing. I have cancer in the left breast, but based on the results of a blood test they did, and my family history, I'm having them take both. I have heard so many women, take one and end up with it in the other. I don't want to go thru this twice, I'd rather do it right the first time and get it over with. Plus, I'm planning reconstruction, and my thoughts are that a new matching set would look better than having one fake one, and one saggy one (although, they told me they would lift the real one to make it match(. Don't let anyone make you second guess your decision, WE are going the right thing!!
Posts.Title: Double mastectomy!

Posts.Content: Happy to hear that yours is done and over with. My surgery will be this Tuesday, I feel confident that I won't look back, I want the cancer gone, and I don't want to ever have to worry that it will come back. Feel better as you heal, we'll get thru all of this.
Posts.Title: Double mastectomy!

Posts.Content: I have taken estrogen replacement since I'm 27..medication Premarin. I'm 50 right now. As I have aged, the dosage was lowered. I have NO ovaries. I had breast cancer in May, and had a DOUBLE mastectomy. Since I have no ovaries, and now no breasts (still in reconstruction stage), I don't understand WHY they won't allow me to go back on this medication. I feel GOOD on premarin, now I'm suffering from SEVERE hot flashes, which seriously makes me feel sick. My breast cancer was estrogen positive, but if I don't have any breasts, how can I get breast cancer again? Why would it be a risk for me to the taken estrogen now? I have asked this question to my "wonderful: doctor, and the reply I was given is...: because you can;t". Ughhhhhhhhhhhhhhh..Anyone?
Posts.Title: Someone please explain Estrogen factor to me

Posts.Content: Mary, Thanks for your response, and I wish you the best of luck with your results. I think all of this waiting is going to drive me NUTS. I have also been extremely exhausted, and have had times of feeling nauseous on and off, which I was having before I even went for the mammograms, so I don't think its stress. Let's keep in touch with each other!!
Posts.Title: Having biospy Tuesday

Posts.Content: I'm 50 years old, strong history of breast cancer in family, including my mother. My last 3 mammograms have been followed by compression and ultrasound. This time they are insisting that I have a biopsy, I think my luck has run out. I have pain and a general discomfort in my left breast, and armpit seems to be swollen since they did the ultrasound last week. I have a copy of the report which is as follows: BIRADS 4 A lobulated mildly irregular 1 cm mass in upper-outer left breast is persistent located in posterior 1/3 that correlates with a hypoechoic heterogeneous mass on ultrasound. This is considered suspicious. No associated significant architectural distortion or microcalcifications. Right now Tuesday seems like a lifetime away, and I'm truly bracing myself for the very worse. I have tried looking things up, but the margins are from 15% to 70% PLEASE someone, level with me, what are my chances...SERIOUSLY? Honestly?
Posts.Title: Having biospy Tuesday

Posts.Content: I had a core biopsy, for me the pain was severe, caused a shooting pain thru out the entire breast into the nipple. My mass is very deep. I asked the doctor doing the test to level with me and give me his honest opinion of my chances. He said...if this comes back negative, I wouldn't believe the results and would suggest you have a surgical biopsy, ughhhhhhhhh. Well, he ordered my labs to be done STAT, and thinks I will have the results back in a day or two..I'll post here and let you know.
Posts.Title: Having biospy Tuesday

Posts.Content: I don't really know if they have me schedules for a needle biopsy or a core biopsy, guess I will find out tomorrow, ugh. I'm glad to hear that it wasn't that bad, I too am worried about the pain of it. I'm thrilled for you that you have already gotten the results back and they were good. Your results make me feel hopeful considering that you stated our mammo compression reports were very similar. I hope I get my results back super fast too, as I agree, the waiting on this is just the worst. I'll post here tomorrow after its done, and then when I get the results.
Posts.Title: Having biospy Tuesday

Posts.Title: Having biospy Tuesday

Posts.Content: I understand how you feel. I was diagnosed in March, and scared to death. I'm 50 years old, with a strong family history of BC including my mom. I had a double mastectomy two weeks ago, and I'm recovering quite nicely, it really wasn't half as bad as I had pictured it all to be in my mind. The plastic surgeon followed my surgery, and placed stretchers into my chest, so that's the first stage for reconstruction. It's strange to see my natural double d's gone, I'm flat as a board right now, but I know in a few months, I will be able to have my second surgery of having the implants placed in. I don't know if I'll need chemo YET, don't get back my reports of whether or not it was in the lymph nodes until Thursday, believe me I'm holding my breath. I can tell you that I have gotten WONDERFUL support from posting on this board, very strong, awesome, survivor woman here, that will help you thru. Keep posting, we are all in this together!!
Posts.Title: 32 and recently diagnosed

Posts.Content: Had my first appt with Oncologist yesterday, I'm freaking out. I have the choice to either have my entire breast removed or just part of it. He then is recommending chemo and radiation afterwards. I'm 50 years old, and totally freaking out. I thought I was a strong woman, but now I realize...not so much. Has anyone else decided just not to do it, and walk away. Makes me wonder how long I would live if I did nothing. I'd have my hair and my breast, not be mutilated and not suffer from chemo. yeah...I'm kinda depressed. My insurance doesn't cover reconstruction because it's government insurance.
Posts.Title: Anyone just not want to do it?

Posts.Content: I'm feeling a little better, I think I was just very depressed when I posted this, feeling sorry for myself. I see the surgeon on Monday, and have decided to remove the entire breast. My life is worth more than a boob, but I really want reconstruction. As for chemo, I'm hormone positive, so I'm still gonna try and skip chemo, but can't really make the choice until after they take out a lymph node or two and see if they are clean or not. Thank ladies for really being here for me, I need this support.
Posts.Title: Anyone just not want to do it?

Posts.Content: I believe that pain is your body's way of telling you that something is wrong. Although, breast pain doesn't have to mean its cancer (it can be many things), pain means something is going on, its not normal to have pain. I can tell you that I did have breast pain for 4 years before they found my breast cancer, I complained every year and had a mammo, and nothing was found, until this year. In my case, I had tenderness and pain in the nipple and areola area, and was diagnosed with breast cancer of the milk ducts which had spread and become invasive into the breast. Breast pain can also come from hormones, many woman have different times of the month where their breasts seem tender, and this is considered normal. You mention your armpit area, which makes me think lymph nodes, that could signal something like Epstein Barr (A simple blood test), and not a cancer situation. In any case, any pain you have, should be checked out by a doctor. Make a appt.
Posts.Title: A lot of pain...help, please
